授業目的: 本講義の目的は、学生が主体的に、古代から現代に至る日本の伝統芸能の歴史や特徴を学ぶとともに、芸能が果たした文化史の面での意義や社会的な役割についても考察する。
到達目標:
The students will gain a comprehensive knowledge of Japanese traditional
 performance culture and deepen their understanding of both the 
historical and social factors that formed the various performing art 
forms, and the intricate workings of power, cultural representation, and 
gender.
特記事項: 【合併】総合日本学習科目（伝統芸能）（CIEC）/Traditional Japanese Theatre（国際学部）
関連科目:
There is no prerequisite for this course but a related course would be 
any standard course on Japanese culture, history and literature.
授業の概要・背景:
This course introduces students to Japanese traditional performing arts, in the broad sense of the term performance: as a 
cultural representation literally imbued with meanings, both artistic 
and social. We examine the main stage arts not only as forms of 
entertainment but also in their historical, social and cultural 
contexts: the early forms kagura and bugaku, the classical noh drama and
 the kyogen comedy, the puppet theatre bunraku, the actor’s theatre 
kabuki, the all-female Takarazuka Revue, geisha performances, and various folk genres. 
Special attention is paid to the performance of gender and the body in 
Japanese culture, and particularly to the female performers in the 
predominantly male theatrical tradition. The course provides the 
students with a firm foundation from which a deeper understanding of the
 role of performing arts in Japanese culture and society is built.

第1回: Introduction to Japanese theatre. Overview of Japanese Cultural History.
第2回: Sources of Japanese theatre I: origins, history, early performing art forms - kagura; folk performing arts, their relation to the recent pandemic.
第3回: Sources of Japanese theatre II: origins, history, early performing art forms - bugaku; folk performing arts.
第5回: Kabuki - actor's theatre: types of plays, role types, elements of performance.
第6回: Kabuki - gender presentation - onnagata's body, screening of plays, discussion. Preparation for the kabuki performance on May 17 or 24.
第7回: Bunraku puppet theatre: history and performance, comparison with kabuki.
第8回:
Bunraku puppet theatre: battles and love suicides. Screening of bunraku plays.
Preparation for the performance at the National Bunraku Theatre in Osaka on June 15.
第9回: Noh theatre: history and development, audiences, elements of performance, types of plays. Noh workshop.

50-60 minutes. Reading and visual materials.

June 16 (Sunday) - Bunraku puppet theatre performance at the National Bunraku Theatre in Osaka (14:30 - 16:45), 1,500 yen.
第10回: Kyogen comedy: types of kyogen, elements of performance, stories.
第11回:
Screening of a noh play and a kyogen play, discussion.
Or noh performance observation in Kyoto on June 22 (Saturday).
第12回: Super Kabuki. Manga and anime in Kabuki and Noh. Contemporary Noh.
第13回: Women in Japanese performing arts: a historical overview. Female versions of all-male performing arts. Geisha performance.
